qas.question: Who suggested that humankind does not exist inside time, but is time?
The relationship to the future is the state of anticipating what?

answers.text: a potential possibility, task, or engagement

qas.question: What is considered a qualitative experience rather than a quantitative one?
According to Heidegger, what can we do, in our thoughts?
Who thought that people are the possibilities they search for?

plausible_answers.text: anticipating a potential possibility, task, or engagement

qas.question: A linear relationship with time is the state of what?
How is the past defined instead of being quantitative?
What is broken when we are stuck in sequential time?
What are we able to do when stuck in sequential time?
Who suggested that humankind does not exist inside the present, but is the present?
What is considered a quantitative experience rather than a qualatative one?
What can we do in the present according to Heldegger?
Who said we do not exist in the future?
What are we able to forget?

context: According to <a0_0><b4_0><b9_0><b12_0>Martin Heidegger<b12_0/><b9_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> we do not exist inside time, we are time. Hence, the relationship to the past is a present awareness of having been, which allows the past to exist in the present. The relationship to the future is the state of <b5_0>anticipating <a1_0>a potential possibility, task, or engagement<b5_0/><a1_0/>. It is related to the human propensity for caring and being concerned, which causes "being ahead of oneself" when thinking of a pending occurrence. Therefore, this concern for a potential occurrence also allows the future to exist in the present. <a2_0><b10_0>The present<b10_0/><a2_0/> becomes an experience, which is <b6_0>qualitative<b6_0/> instead of quantitative. Heidegger seems to think this is the way that <b7_0>a linear relationship with time<b7_0/>, or temporal existence, is broken or transcended. We are not stuck in sequential time. We are able to remember <b13_0>the past<b13_0/> and project into the future—we have a kind of random access to our representation of temporal existence; we can, in our thoughts, <a3_0><b8_0><b11_0>step out of (ecstasis) sequential time<b11_0/><b8_0/>.
